Description: Primary key of the study.
Researcher ID of the first screener.
Researcher ID of the second screener (in case of double checking).
General notes on the study, applicable to all model specifications within the study.

Model specific notes (also use this to indicate the presence of multiple models if none of the other extracted variables identifies the muliple models from a specific study, e.g. regimes/state-dependency that we do not extract).
Number of the figure from which the impulse response is taken. (if number contains an A for appendix write it as a string e.g. A2, if number not stated in the document code as null)
Page on which the impulse response is displayed. (page number displayed in the original document, if not available use the pdf page number)
Dummy if IRF is available (true if IRF is available; false if not)
Type of short term interest rate variable which is shocked (add here on the fly). If no information is provided or the paper only states "interest rate" code as "null".
Motivation_theory: e.g. Bauer and Swanson use 2 year treasury yield, fed funds rate, real interest rate,....

Description: Shock size in basis points e.g., 100 = 1pp. How to deal with 1% shock?
note if the axis scale needs to be transformed to be in percentage scale or another scale. Additionally add the information to the IRF picture.
Vector of variable names + transformation of the variabe and real or nominal (add here on the fly)
Level of the confidence bounds or standard errors (add here on the fly)
1 if outcome variable is of main research interest for the paper
1 if estimate (model specification) is preferred in underlying study
1 if Instrumental Variable - dummy for internal or external instrument (=Proxy SVAR) or for identifaction of impulse responses?
Motivation_theory: Same dummy for internal and external instrument as well as for LP-IV? pre registration plan: ?berbegriffe ja + beispiele zu variablen die wir erfassen wollen wenn wir hypothesen zu deren Einfluss haben. Zwei gruppen von Moderatorvariablen: die mit hypothesen (z.b. Regime dependent) und explorative Variablen.

Description: 1 if forecast based identification strategy is used, as for example in Romer and Romer (2004) for detailed description see github issue 41 in the data repository
1 if Narrative record
1 if Event study or direct measurement of the shock
Motivation_theory: Probably not that many and code togehter with narrative record, romer and romer 2010, or paper looking at the changes in eurodollar rates around FOMC meetings. SIRF can be directly obtained according to Stock and Watson 2016 p. 460

Description: 1 if obtained by recursive Cholesky identification - irrespective of the order of the variables (but note quality constraint if conteporaneous effect of inflation or output are zero on the interest rate). Hence the system of short run restrictions sets all the contemporaneous effects of variables ordered above on the variables ordered below to zero (and tries to estimates all the parameters of the lower triangular identification matrix of the monetary part).
Motivation_theory: Or more detailed on the ordering of the variables

Description: 1 if SVAR (for any other structural identification other than cholesky if the contemporaneous elasticities in the upper triangular of the identification matrix are set to some specific value instead of zero as for choleski or are not estimated in case of the lower triangular matrix)
Motivation_theory: Code the structure of the VAR? See Ramey page 78

Description: 1 if obtained by employing sign restrictions (also known as ?set identification? or partial identification)
Motivation_theory: Or maybe exclude those responses where the variable of interest is sign restricted. In this case we do not need this moderator variable see Uhlig 2005

Description: 1 if high frequency identification is used
Motivation_theory: Is one identification method according to Ramey (2016)

Description: 1 if Identification by Heteroskedasticity
Motivation_theory: Identification Method according to Stock and Watson 2016

Description: 1 of identification by Long-Run Restrictions
Motivation_theory: Identification Method according to Stock and Watson 2016

Description: 1 if Other
1 if Vector Autoregression Model
1 if Local Projections
Vector error correction model
1 if dynamic OLS (ARDL? ECM? ? ?) (add here on the fly)
1 if factor-augmented VAR
Reference: Papadamou et al. 2019, Havranek and Rusnak 2013

Description: 1 if time-varying parameter VAR
Reference: Papadamou et al. 2019, Havranek and Rusnak 2013

Description: 1 if global VAR
1 if Bayesian methods
Reference: Papadamou et al. 2019, Havranek and Rusnak 2013

Description: 1 if estimated DSGE
1 if other VAR approach
1 if definition of a 'recession' or 'downswing' regime lag-polynomial in a transition VAR or of there is clear indication in the text that the estimated value is relevant for a downswing period
Motivation_theory: Jorda 2020: Specifically, we find that stimulating a weak economy is much harder than reining in a strong one.

Description: 1 if definition of an 'upswing' or 'bom' regime lag-polynomial in a transition VAR or of there is clear indication in the text that the estimated value is relevant for an upswing period

1 if definition of a 'supply constrained' or 'a supply shock' regime lag-polynomial in a transition VAR or of there is clear indication in the text that the estimated value is relevant for a supply constrained period

1 if definition of a 'demand constrained' or 'a demand shock' regime lag-polynomial in a transition VAR or of there is clear indication in the text that the estimated value is relevant for a demand constrained period
1 if estimate is for an interest rate hike
Motivation_theory: Only if assymetric model is estimated

Description: 1 if estimate is for an interest rate cut
Motivation_theory: Only if assymetric model is estimated

Description: 1 if annual data are used
1 if quarterly data are used
1 if monthly data are used
List of countries if Panel is used (iso2 code, "EA" for Euro area)
Motivation_theory: Collect in the database, not used for estimation, construct dummy variables with this list?

Description: Number of countries in sample
1 if Panel(VAR)
Sample start (https://www.r-bloggers.com/2013/08/date-formats-in-r/) for format codes
Entries:
for monthly data: "%m-%Y" 
for quarterly data: "Q%q-%Y" 
for yearly data: "%Y"
Motivation_theory: included in database but probably not in the estimation. Extract to calculate the mean year and the timespan and sample start dummies.

Description: Sample end (https://www.r-bloggers.com/2013/08/date-formats-in-r/) for format codes
Entries:
for monthly data: "%m-%Y" 
for quarterly data: "Q%q-%Y" 
for yearly data: "%Y"
Motivation_theory: included in database but probably not in the estimation. Extract to calculate the mean year and the timespan and sample start dummies.

Description: Sample size for estimation. For details see: https://github.com/META-CMP/data/issues/22
1 if commodity price variable is included
Motivation_theory: Aus Ramey (2016): Sims (1992) conjectured that the Federal Reserve used more information about future movements in inflation than was commonly included in the VAR. He showed that the price puzzle was substantially reduced if commodity prices, often a harbinger of future inflation, were included in the VAR. Rusnake et al. 2013 find that its inclusion drives the results in the literature.

Description: 1 if output gap variable is included
Motivation_theory: Aus Rusnak et al. 2013: Giordani (2004) argues that the use of GDP in the VAR system without controlling for the potential of the economy can bias the estimates and cause the price puzzle.

Description: 1 if financial development is controlled for
Reference: Havranek and Rusnak 2013 Ehrenbergerova et al. 2021

Description: 1 if economic globalisation is controlled for
1 if central bank independence is controlled for
1 if exchange rate regime is controlled for
1 if inflation expectations variable is included
Motivation_theory: Aus Ramey (2016): Boivin et al. (2010) find that in a standard VAR the results for prices are very sensitive to the specification. Inclusion of a commodity price index does not resolve the price puzzle, but inclusion of a measure of expected inflation does resolve it in the post-1984:1 period.

Description: 1 if a foreign interest rate is included (how to handle in panel setting, probably =1)
1 if the exchange rate is included

1 if the long-run interest rate (in addition to the short-run
interest rate) is included
Motivation_theory:
Regarding specication characteristics, we nd that the omission of long-term interest rates and variables related to liquidity (credit or money supply) is associated with stronger responses of house prices to changes in the policy
rate.

Description: 1 if monetary policy shock plausibly only covers conventional monetary policy
1 if monetary policy shock is decomposed into several parts (conventional, unconventional, information, forward guidance, …)
1 if exchange rate regime is fixed
Average inflation rate over the sample period for which the output coefficient was estimated
Motivation_theory: Jorda 2020: Yet another source of state dependence comes from the level of inflation, however. Additionally include Regime dummies for low and high inflation regimes.

Description: Inflation variability, standard deviation inflation over time
Average trade openness over the sample period (KOF index)
Average financial openness over the sample period
Average GDP per capita over the sample period
Average financial development over the sample period (domestic credit to private sector in % of GDP)
Motivation_theory: Jorda 2020: State dependence in credit boom and bust episodes. Or additionally include regime dummies?

Description: Average central bank independence over the sample period (index)
Average unemployment rate over the sample period
Motivation_theory: additional variables on workers bargaining power?

Description: Share of years which are supply constrained, or with supply price shocks
Number of citations (Ehrenbergerova et al. 2022 use google scholar citations within the first three years p.17)
Journal impact factor
Motivation_theory: which impact factor?

Description: 1 if at least one coauthor is affiliated with a central bank - dummy 1-0 (BIS ja, Zeipunkt des Papiers) auch wenn in CB paper erschienen 1
1 if study is found via snowballing. Maybe 0-2 if we include a second round of snowballing
Reason for exclusion after full text screening for definition see: https://github.com/META-CMP/data/issues/37
Entries: no_relevant_effect_sizes; no_original_estimate; shock_size_unclear; calibrated_model; disagregated_responses_only; no_se; wrong_response_variable; wrong_shock_variable; no_comparable_effect_sizes
